newsitem.title: UK: FORECAST-Modest Wolseley H1 profit rise seen.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Modest Wolseley H1 profit rise seen.

text.p: UK building materials group Wolseley Plc is expected to report a modest rise in half year pretax profits on Tuesday, according to analysts' forecasts.
Half year pretax profits are expected to be between 117 million and 122 million stg, with the average forecast pitched at 120.5 million. That compares with 120.5 million last year.
The interim dividend is expected to be between 3.25 pence and 3.4 pence per share, with most analysts pitching at the 3.25 pence level. Last year's half year payout was 3.10 pence per share.

The shares had seen strong gains in recent months on switching out of stocks with high Continental exposure into Wolseley. Poor French and German building markets have helped to depress sentiment in vulnerable stocks like Redland Plc and RMC. Though Wolseley does have some French and Austrian business.
Wolseley was down one pence at 504-1/2 pence per share at 1600 GMT on Friday, below the year high of 515 pence.
The results are expected to benefit from the relatively low European exposure, which has faced a double-whammy of weak growth and strong sterling.
Also, in January the group gave an upbeat forecast for U.S. operations. UBS analysts said expansion in plumping, heating and industrial supplies should push U.S. profits ahead.
The rebound in the UK construction and housing markets should also buttress that position, said analysts.
